Description¶

Utility functions relating to the Maya Node Editor.

Widget Hierarchy¶

The Node Editor has the following simplified widget hierarchy (verified for Maya 2019):

- Window (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget)

- Panel (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget)

- Menu Bar (PySide2.QtWidgets.QMenuBar)

- Container (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget - placeholder for cmds.formLayout())

- Container (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget - placeholder for cmds.frameLayout())

- Container (PySide2.QtWidgets.QFrame)

- Icon Bar (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget - placeholder for cmds.flowLayout())

- Container (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget - placeholder for cmds.paneLayout())

- Container (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget)

- Editor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget)

- Tab Bar (PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar)

- Page Area (PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget)

- Pages (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget)

- View (PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsView)

- Viewport (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget)

Widget Lifetime¶

The following groups of Node Editor widgets should share the same lifetimes.

  • window, panel, menu bar, icon bar.
  • editor, tab bar, page area.
  • page, view, viewport, scene.

Note

  1. A Node Editor panel can be created with cmds.scriptedPanel() using type = "nodeEditorPanel". The initial Node Editor panel will contain the primary Node Editor editor. There can only ever be a single primary Node Editor. The primary editor is the only one that has a visible tab bar.

Note

  1. A Node Editor editor can be queried and modified with cmds.nodeEditor().

Note

  1. The name of the primary Node Editor editor can be retrieved with the MEL command getPrimaryNodeEditor.

Note

  1. A reference to a page must be kept in memory in order to access its descendant widgets. The editor maintains ownership of all page widgets. Any reference to a descendant will be automatically invalidated unless a reference to the page remains in memory.

Note

  1. When opening a new scene, Maya will delete each page for any existing tab in the Node Editor. The tab count will sequentially decrement to zero then increment back to one.

Note

  1. Whilst a tab is being dragged, the PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget.count() (editor) and PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar.count() (tab bar) will decrement. Only the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget.count() (page area) will remain unchanged.

Note

  1. The PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget.count() (editor) and PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar.count() (tab bar) are influenced by the ‘Add a new tab’ button. Their value is one greater than the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget.count() (page area), even for non-primary editors whose tab bar is hidden.

Note

  1. Whilst a tab is being dragged, the PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget.currentIndex() (editor) and PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar.currentIndex() (tab bar) and PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget.currentIndex() (page area) will all update dynamically.

Note

  1. The PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget.currentIndex() (editor) and PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar.currentIndex() (tab bar) may be influenced by the ‘Add a new tab’ button. It is possible to select this button with ctrl + tab, meaning only PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget.currentIndex() (page area) is reliable.

Note

  1. There is a margin of two units between the viewport and its parent view. Therefore the viewport should be used to acquire dimensions.

Warning

  1. Using cmds.nodeEditor() to query the panel of an editor will just remove "NodeEditorEd" from the name of the editor. It does not consider the possibility that the editor has been unparented and reparented to a different panel using cmds.nodeEditor().

Warning

  1. Using the MEL procedure getCurrentNodeEditor to query the editor which has focus will just add "NodeEditorEd" to the result of getCurrentNodeEditorPanel. It does not consider the possibility that the editor has been unparented and no longer exists.

Warning

  1. Do not attempt to access a Node Editor PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsView via PySide2.QtCore.QObject.findChildren().
    • A view will often show as a PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget within the descendant hierarchy, requiring a cast.
    • When opening a new scene, Maya will create a new view as discussed in note-5. However previous invalidated views may remain temporarily parented to an existing page before being removed.
    • When a view is created it is initially parented to the editor. Only when Maya reaches idle will a view be reparented to its associated page. Operating on a view which has not been reparented may cause it to be deleted.
class msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.NodeEditorGraphicsItem¶

Bases: object

A namespace for Node Editor graphics item type constants.

These are the unique values returned from PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem.type().

NODE = 65545¶
PATH = 65548¶
PLUG = 65540¶
SIMPLE_TEXT = 65549¶

msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditor()¶

Return the Node Editor editor for the panel which currently has focus.

The editor manages associations between the PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar tabs and the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget pages. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Note

Only the primary editor allows tabs (ie. multiple views). Non-primary editors are only allowed to display a single view (the tab bar is hidden).

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Raises:msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If a current Node Editor editor could not be identified (ie. there is no panel with focus).
Returns:PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget – The current Node Editor editor widget.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditorGraphicsItemsFromEditor(nodeEditor, itemType=None)¶

Return the Node Editor graphics items that exist within the scene for the view that is currently visible in the given Node Editor editor.

Graphics items provide a graphical interface for objects such as nodes, plugs and edges. Each item is contained within a scene. A view is used to visualise the contents of a scene by rendering to a viewport. The current tab determines the current scene visualised within the editor. The user can visualise a different scene by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:
  • nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
  • itemType (int) – Specify the type of graphics items to return based on their PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem.type() constant. Possible values include NodeEditorGraphicsItem.NODE, NodeEditorGraphicsItem.PLUG, NodeEditorGraphicsItem.PATH and NodeEditorGraphicsItem.SIMPLE_TEXT. Defaults to None - all graphics items will be included.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a current scene.
Returns:

list [T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem] – The graphics items that exist within the scene for the view that is currently visible in the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditorGraphicsSceneFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor scene for the view that is currently visible in the given Node Editor editor.

A scene serves as a container for graphics items. A view is used to visualise the contents of a scene by rendering to a viewport. The current tab determines the current scene visualised within the editor. The user can visualise a different scene by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a current scene.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene – The scene for the view that is currently visible in the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditorGraphicsViewFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor view which is visible in the given Node Editor editor.

A view is used to visualise the contents of a scene by rendering graphics items to a viewport. There exists a view for each page. The current tab determines the current view shown in the editor. The user can show a different view by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a current view.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsView – The current view widget shown in the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditorPageFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor page which is visible in the given Node Editor editor.

A page is used to display the contents of a view for a specific tab. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a current page.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget – The current page widget shown in the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getCurrentNodeEditorViewportFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor viewport that is currently visible in the given Node Editor editor.

A viewport provides a scrollable area for visualising a scene within a view. It allows the user to determine which region of a scene is visualised. The current tab determines the current viewport shown in the editor. The user can show a different viewport by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The results of this function are c++ widget references which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a current viewport.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget – The viewport that is currently visible in the nodeEditor
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getGraphicsItemFromNode(node, nodeEditorGraphicsScene)¶

Return a graphics item for the given dependency node wrapper, if one exists within the given Node Editor graphics scene.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – A dependency node wrapper.
  • nodeEditorGraphicsScene (PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene) – The Node Editor graphics scene containing a graphics item for the given node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditorGraphicsScene does not reference a Node Editor graphics scene.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If a graphics item could not be identified for the given node.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem – A graphics item within the given nodeEditorGraphicsScene, corresponding to the given node.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getInterestingNodeEditorWidgetsFromEditor(nodeEditor, allTabs=False)¶

Return interesting objects in the descendant hierarchy of the given Node Editor editor.

Parameters:
  • nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
  • allTabs (bool, optional) – Whether to return objects for each existing tab. If True, the NodeEditorObject.PAGE, NodeEditorObject.VIEW, NodeEditorObject.VIEWPORT and NodeEditorObject.SCENE keys will each map to a list of objects instead of a single object for the current tab. Defaults to False.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Raises:msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
Returns:dict [NodeEditorObject, T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QObject] – A dictionary mapping enumerations to objects in the descendant hierarchy of nodeEditor.
  • NodeEditorObject.EDITOR: The given nodeEditor.
  • NodeEditorObject.TAB_BAR: The Node Editor tab bar.
  • NodeEditorObject.PAGE_AREA: The Node Editor page area.
  • NodeEditorObject.PAGE: The Node Editor pages.
  • NodeEditorObject.VIEW: The Node Editor views.
  • NodeEditorObject.VIEWPORT: The Node Editor viewports.
  • NodeEditorObject.SCENE: The Node Editor scenes.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getInterestingNodeEditorWidgetsFromPanel(nodeEditorPanel, allTabs=False)¶

Return interesting objects in the descendant hierarchy of the given Node Editor panel.

Parameters:
  • nodeEditorPanel (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor panel widget.
  • allTabs (bool, optional) – Whether to return objects for each existing tab. If True, the NodeEditorObject.PAGE, NodeEditorObject.VIEW, NodeEditorObject.VIEWPORT and NodeEditorObject.SCENE keys will each map to a list of objects instead of a single object for the current tab. Defaults to False.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Raises:msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditorPanel does not reference a Node Editor panel.
Returns:dict [NodeEditorObject, T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QObject] – A dictionary mapping enumerations to objects in the descendant hierarchy of nodeEditorPanel.
  • NodeEditorObject.PANEL: The given nodeEditorPanel.
  • NodeEditorObject.MENU_BAR: The Node Editor menu bar.
  • NodeEditorObject.ICON_BAR: The Node Editor icon bar.
  • NodeEditorObject.EDITOR: The Node Editor editor if one exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.TAB_BAR: The Node Editor tab bar if an editor exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.PAGE_AREA: The Node Editor page area if an editor exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.PAGE: The Node Editor pages if an editor exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.VIEW: The Node Editor views if an editor exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.VIEWPORT: The Node Editor viewports if an editor exists, else None.
  • NodeEditorObject.SCENE: The Node Editor scenes if an editor exists, else None.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorFromPanel(nodeEditorPanel)¶

Return the Node Editor editor for the given Node Editor panel.

The editor manages associations between the PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar tabs and the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget pages. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Note

It is possible to unparent a Node Editor editor from its panel. Meaning it is not guaranteed a Node Editor panel will have an editor.

Only the primary editor allows tabs (ie. multiple views). Non-primary editors are only allowed to display a single view (the tab bar is hidden).

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditorPanel (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor panel widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditorPanel does not reference a Node Editor panel.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditorPanel does not have a descendant editor.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget – The descendant Node Editor editor widget for the nodeEditorPanel.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorGraphicsScenesFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor scenes for the given Node Editor editor.

A scene serves as a container for graphics items. A view is used to visualise the contents of a scene by rendering to a viewport. The current tab determines the current scene visualised within the editor. The user can visualise a different scene by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have any scenes.
Returns:

list [PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene] – Sequence of scene objects for the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorGraphicsViewsFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor views for the given Node Editor editor.

A view is used to visualise the contents of a scene by rendering graphics items to a viewport. There exists a view for each page. The current tab determines the current view shown in the editor. The user can show a different view by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The results of this function are c++ widget references which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have any views.
Returns:list [PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsView] – Sequence of view widgets for the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorIconBarFromPanel(nodeEditorPanel)¶

Return the Node Editor icon bar for the given Node Editor panel.

The icon bar contains all icon elements directly below the menu bar (eg. create node, layout, search, etc). The icon bar widget exists as a placeholder for a cmds.flowLayout().

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditorPanel (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor panel widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditorPanel does not reference a Node Editor panel.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditorPanel does not have a descendant icon bar.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget – The descendant icon bar widget for the nodeEditorPanel.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorMenuBarFromPanel(nodeEditorPanel)¶

Return the Node Editor menu bar for the given Node Editor panel.

The menu bar contains all menu items (eg. Edit, View, Bookmarks, etc).

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditorPanel (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor panel widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditorPanel does not reference a Node Editor panel.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditorPanel does not have a child menu bar.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QMenuBar – The child menu bar widget for the nodeEditorPanel.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorPageAreaFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor page area for the given Node Editor editor.

The page area provides an area for displaying pages. Each page contains a view for rendering graphics items. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a child page area.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget – The child Node Editor page area widget for the nodeEditor.

Returns:

msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorPanelFromDescendant(nodeEditorDescendant)¶

Return the Node Editor panel for the given Node Editor descendant widget.

The panel contains a menu bar, icon bar and usually an editor.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:nodeEditorDescendant (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditorDescendant does not have an ancestral panel.
Returns:PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget – The ancestral panel widget for the nodeEditorDescendant.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeEditorTabBarFromEditor(nodeEditor)¶

Return the Node Editor tab bar for the given Node Editor editor.

The tab bar provides a user interface for managing the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget pages. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Note

The tab bar will only be visible in the primary editor.

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Parameters:

nodeEditor (PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor editor widget.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If nodeEditor does not reference a Node Editor editor.
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If nodeEditor does not have a child tab bar.
Returns:

PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar – The child Node Editor tab bar widget for the nodeEditor.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getNodeFromGraphicsItem(nodeGraphicsItem)¶

Return a dependency node wrapper for the given Node Editor graphical node item.

Parameters:

nodeGraphicsItem (PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsItem) – A graphical node item whose type is equivalent to NodeEditorGraphicsItem.NODE.
Raises:
  • msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUITypeError – If the nodeGraphicsItem type is not equivalent to NodeEditorGraphicsItem.NODE.
  • RuntimeError – If a dependency node could not be identified for the given nodeGraphicsItem.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – A dependency node wrapper corresponding to the given nodeGraphicsItem.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.getPrimaryNodeEditor()¶

Return the primary Node Editor editor.

The editor manages associations between the PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabBar tabs and the PySide2.QtWidgets.QStackedWidget pages. The current tab determines the current page shown in the editor. The user can show a different page by clicking on its associated tab.

Note

Only the primary editor allows tabs (ie. multiple views). Non-primary editors are only allowed to display a single view (the tab bar is hidden).

Warning

The result of this function is a c++ widget reference which should be discarded at the next idle.

This function is not guaranteed to remain operable. It relies on a specific state of the Maya UI which is subject to change in future versions.

Raises:msTools.coreUI.maya.exceptions.MayaUILookupError – If a primary Node Editor editor could not be identified.
Returns:PySide2.QtWidgets.QTabWidget – The primary Node Editor editor widget.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.isNodeEditorObject(nodeEditorObject, nodeEditorObjectType)¶

Verify the type of a Node Editor object based on a set of compiled expectations.

Parameters:
  • nodeEditorObject (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – A Node Editor object.
  • nodeEditorObjectType (NodeEditorObject) – An enumeration representing the expected nodeEditorObject type.
Returns:

bool – True if nodeEditorObject corresponds to the nodeEditorObjectType, otherwise False.
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.GRAPHICS_SCENE_TO_GRAPHVIZ_TRANSFORM = PySide2.QtGui.QTransform(0.010000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, -0.010000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 1.000000)¶

Transforms PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene coordinates into a Graphviz coordinate space.

Coordinates in this space can be used to position nodes within the Node Editor by passing a minimal graph description to the dotFormat argument of the cmds.nodeEditor() command. The graph description must be provided in the plain format of the DOT language.

Note

The transformation inverts the vertical axis. The PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene adopts y-down coordinates whilst Graphviz adopts standard y-up coordinates.

Example

The following example demonstrates how to position the node named "transform1" on the cursor.

nodeEditor = getPrimaryNodeEditor()
graphicsView = getCurrentNodeEditorGraphicsViewFromEditor(nodeEditor)
viewport = graphicsView.viewport()

# Determine the cursor position in QGraphicsView viewport coordinates
cursorPos_viewport = viewport.mapFromGlobal(QtGui.QCursor.pos())
# The QGraphicsView is used to map viewport coordinates to QGraphicsScene coordinates
cursorPos_scene = graphicsView.mapToScene(cursorPos_viewport)
# Offset the position so that the node title is centered on the cursor
nodePos_scene = QtCore.QPointF(cursorPos_scene.x() - 67.5, cursorPos_scene.y())
# Determine the node position in Graphviz coordinates
nodePos_graphviz = nodePos_scene * GRAPHICS_SCENE_TO_GRAPHVIZ_TRANSFORM

# Generate a plain formatted DOT language graph description
# The `graphWidth`, `graphHeight`, `nodeWidth` and `nodeHeight` should be ignored in this case
graph = "graph {graphScale} {graphWidth} {graphHeight}\nnode {nodeName} {nodeX} {nodeY} {nodeWidth} {nodeHeight}\nstop".format(
    graphScale=1.0, graphWidth=0.0, graphHeight=0.0,
    nodeName="transform1", nodeX=nodePos_graphviz.x(), nodeY=nodePos_graphviz.y(), nodeWidth=0.0, nodeHeight=0.0)

cmds.nodeEditor(nodeEditor.objectName(), e=True, dotFormat=graph)
Type:PySide2.QtGui.QTransform
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.GRAPHICS_SCENE_TO_NODE_EDITOR_TRANSFORM = PySide2.QtGui.QTransform(1.428571, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, -1.428571, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 1.000000)¶

Transforms PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene coordinates into the Node Editor’s coordinate space.

Coordinates in this space are used to save the positions of nodes in the Node Editor via nodeGraphEditorInfo nodes.

Note

The transformation inverts the vertical axis. The PySide2.QtWidgets.QGraphicsScene adopts y-down coordinates whilst the Node Editor adopts standard y-up coordinates.

Example

The following example demonstrates how to determine these contant scaling factors. It requires a bookmark to be created in the Node Editor so we can read the viewRectLow or viewRectHigh attributes of the nodeGraphEditorBookmarkInfo node.

nodeEditor = getPrimaryNodeEditor()
graphicsView = getCurrentNodeEditorGraphicsViewFromEditor(nodeEditor)
viewport = graphicsView.viewport()

# Use the viewport size since there is a 2px border between it and the graphics view
viewportSize = viewport.size()

# Use the QGraphicsView to map viewport coordinates to QGraphicsScene coordinates
sceneBottomLeftPos = graphicsView.mapToScene(0, viewportSize.height())

# Use the `viewXL` and `viewYL` attributes from the `nodeGraphEditorBookmarkInfo` node
sceneToNodeEditorScaleX = viewXL / sceneBottomLeftPos.x()
sceneToNodeEditorScaleY = viewYL / sceneBottomLeftPos.y()
Type:PySide2.QtGui.QTransform
msTools.coreUI.maya.nodeEditor_utils.NODE_EDITOR_TO_GRAPHVIZ_TRANSFORM = PySide2.QtGui.QTransform(0.700000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.700000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 1.000000)¶

Transforms Node Editor coordinates into a Graphviz coordinate space.

Coordinates in this space can be used to position nodes within the Node Editor by passing a minimal graph description to the dotFormat argument of the cmds.nodeEditor() command. The graph description must be provided in the plain format of the DOT language.

Note

Both the input and output coordinate spaces adopt standard y-up coordinates.

Type:PySide2.QtGui.QTransform
